newsitem.title: FINLAND: ASKO'S UPONOR BUYS US PIPE JOINT OPERATION.
newsitem.headline: ASKO'S UPONOR BUYS US PIPE JOINT OPERATION.

text.p: Finnish pipe and furniture group Asko Oy's plastic pipes unit Uponor said in a statement on Wednesday it had bought U.S. Raychem Corporation's plastic pipe joints operations.
Uponor did not disclose the value of the deal.
The deal is a continuation of a cooperation agreement reached in summer 1995, it said.
"The deal comprises mechanical MetFit crimp joints and new generation SmartHeat thermal joints," it said.

"In addition to the exisiting business and technology, Uponor got the right to third generation electricity conducting joint technology and the right and finance to many years of research cooperation with U.S. Gas Research Insitute," it added.
The acquisition will broaden the product range of Uponor's gas pipe business, Asko said.
